titleStmt.title: Indenture of covenant between Sir Thomas West, Lord La Warre and Robert Thorne 31 January, 1532

div.p:
This indenture maed the last day of January in the xxiijto yere of the reigne of Kyng Harry the Viijth bitwene the Right Honorable Sir Thomas West Knyght Lorde Lawarr of the one partie And Roberte Thorne Citzen
&and merchuant of London on the other partie. Witnessithe that it is covenantid &and agreid bitwene the said parties in maner &and forme folowing. That is to say the seyde Robert Thorne covenantith grantith &and agreethe to &and wtwith the sayd
Lord Lawarr that if a sure sufficient &and ?indesciable estate in fee simple be made or causid to be maed ?or conveyed by the sayd Lorde Lawarr &and one George Croft master of the house & and hospitall of Seint Bartilinaws in the subarbes of the towne of Bristowe or by any of them to the said Robert Thorne & andto Nicholas Thorne & and oon John Goodriche clerke or to the one ?lyvers of them & and their heires as shalbe avised by the lerynd councell
of the seid Roberte Thorne or his heires wtin within one yere next after the date hereof &and in the seid house &and hospitall of Seint Bartilmaws and of &and in all the lordshippes manors manors messuages londes tenementes rentes reversions
&and services wtwith their appertenances whiche be taken usid reputid or accepted ad parcell of the said or hospitall or as parcell of the landes or tenementes rentes reversions or services to the seyd house or hospitall in any maner
apperteynyng or belonginge or whiche the seid George Croft master of the seid house or hospitall &and brethern &and Susterne of the same or any or any them have had holden or enjoied as in the right of the seid
house or hospitall That then the seyd Roberte Thorn wtin within the space & and terme of vj yeres next ymmediately after the date hereof shall ?order prapare &and make a convenyent Scolehouse for a fre grammer scole to be
tawght &and kepte wtinwithin the town of Bristowe or wtin within the subarbes of the same uppon the sayd house or hospitall or uppon [?sn] partte of the seid londes or tenementes belongyng to the seyd house or hospitall
And also the same Robert wtin within the same terme shall provyde Establyshe &and ordein A Scolemaster &and an Ushier to teche &and kepe the sayd fre scole wtwith suche convenyent Wages to them to be appoynted as shall
or may convenyently come of the rentes issues &and profittes of the seyd landes and also the ?same Robert shall appoynt make &and Establyshe wtinwithin the same terme of vj yeres the foundacon statutes &and ordynances of the
sayde scole after the mynde &and advise of John Barlowe deane of Westbury upon Trym in the countie of Glocester and of the forseyd George Croft Robert Thorne Nicholas Thorne &and John Goodriche clerke
or of iiij or iij of them at laste wherof the seid George Croft to be one if he be [?lyvyng] [...] [?..tur[es]] &and wrytnges ?tripartite Wherof one parte shall remayn allweys wt with the seyde Lorde Lawarr & and his heires an other
parte w[ith] the mayre &et comynaltie of the seid towne of Bristowe &et the therd parte [...] RoberThorne &and his hayres for ever and the said Robert convenantith to &and wt with the seid Lorde Lawarr by this presentes that
uppon the seid foundacon, statutes] & and ordynances the seide lorde Lawarr shalbe mayde &and r[...] as one of the prcypoll founders of the sed scole and the seyd George Croft to be namyd &and taken a singular benefactor
thereof. And also that upon the seid foundacon &and writynges suche aricles &and agrementes as ?here after folowith shallbe put ordeynd &and oppyntid ?therm. That is to sey that there shalbe a solempne obit kepte yerely
for ever at the xjth day October at the seyd Bartilmews to praye for the soules of the Lorde Lawarr John &and Robert &and Sir Thomas now Lorde Lawarr &and for the soules of Sir Thomas West knight late lorde Lawarr Thomas West, seventh Baron West and eighth Baron de la Warr (1448 - 1525) &and Elizabeth his wyff late fader &and moder to the seid nowe lord Lawarr &and for the ?soules of all their antecessors &and progenito[r]s &and this obit to be kepte wtwith x pristes &and vj clerkes at which obit ther shalbe delte
& and distribute in almes among[es] poore people a hundreth pens at lest. Also that the Scolemaster &and usher shall ?oppeyre &and assign the scolars of the seid scole to sey suche certeyn prayers at their departyng in the evenyng as
shalbe devysd or oppoynted by the seyd lorde lawarr and also the seyde Robert Thorne ?covenantith &et ?grantith that all suche almes people as nowe be in the seyd house or hospitall of the seyd Bartilimews shall
nott be put awey but still to continue there &and have every weke v d a pece duryng their lyvis if they and also that there shalbe a prist founde to p[ray] for the soules of the founders &and benefacto[r]s untill
suche tyme as the seyde scole be ?ordained &and made ?and also a scole master resident &and in possession ?than for the w[hich] articles covena]ntes &and agreementes before rehersyd on the p[ar]tie of the seyd Robert tobe p[er]formed & and kepte
and for dyvers other consideracons had &and done by the seyd Robert Thorne to the seyde Thomas ?West Knyght Lorde Lawarr. The same Thomas coven[an]tith & and gr[a]ntith to renownce &and relinquysh &and by these presentes doth utterly
renownce & and relinquishe all his interest, titell, right & and clayme as well in the seide house, hospitall & and other the p[re]misses as in the patronage or foundacon thereof savyng onely to ?brynd suche preemynens in the name of the seyd
foundacon & and in suche ?p[ra]yre & and suffrages as before rehercyd. In winess whereof the parties afor seyd to ther indentures ?interchu[a]ngable every to other have put their seales the day year aforseyd
